intro: Medinilla sorsogonensis, commonly known as the Sorsogon Province medinilla, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth surface and a fragrant scent. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
